I don’t understand the moderator ranks, what is moderator emeritus, [@sal_vager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/16426-sal_vager/),s rank is that

> 23 minutes ago, <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Crasher said:
> 
> 
> I don’t understand the moderator ranks, what is moderator emeritus, [@sal_vager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/16426-sal_vager/),s rank is that
> 

e·mer·i·tus

/əˈmerədəs/

*adjective*

adjective: **emeritus**

1. (of the former holder of an office, especially a college professor) having retired but allowed to retain their title as an honor.

"emeritus professor of microbiology"

> 
> 
> On 8/31/2020 at 4:56 PM, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> There's only one emeritus, which is an honorary title for a person who has left the forum to pursue other interests, but who we wanted to remember because he did unbelievable amounts of work for the forum during his tenure.
> 

Also,

> 
> 
> On 1/26/2021 at 2:26 PM, Snark said:
> 
> 
> Sal's special.  He was a mentor and friend to us during his time here.  For those of us who've been fortunate enough to know him personally, he's the guy who showed us what it means to be a moderator here.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The special title is our small way of honoring him.
>

> On 12/12/2021 at 6:41 AM, ColdJ said:
> 
> 
> You have many layers. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

To be honest, the "dumb onion" thing started off as a joke about five years back. We've been hit with sensitivity training on the community college campus where I work at for the last five years, each year it has gotten more over-the-top. Having to be careful of what I say on the campus, I changed "dumb bunny" as so I would not offend bunnies, people identifying as bunnies, or people who like bunnies to "dumb onion."

I do have many layers, though. So, yes, your observation is correct.
![layers-cakes-have-layers.jpg](https://memegenerator.net/img/instances/62286459/layers-cakes-have-layers.jpg)

Yeah, and let's try to keep that thread that way. Besides, I looked at the thread after your post. And not one *fan* on it! What a disappointment.

![51IECVWHnXL._AC_SL1000_.jpg](https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/51IECVWHnXL._AC_SL1000_.jpg)

I bought a fan off Amazon for my bedroom, as I have to keep air circulating and need white noise to be able to sleep thanks to tinnitus and claustrophobia. So, when you highlighted that post and it said *regarding fan pages*, I became exicted! Who would have thought we have pages dedicated to *fans!* Wow, was I disappointed. What a complete waste of a perfectly good mouse-click. Had I known that, I could have messed with that "Don't Click This" thread! ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif ":huh:")

Man! My seven year Necropost letting people know that BrickMod was back in development looks like small potatoes!

> 
> 
> 19 minutes ago, AtomicTech said:
> 
> 
> Man! My seven year Necropost letting people know that BrickMod was back in development looks like small potatoes!
> 

That’s not a necro.   If you post to an old thread and have something significant to contribute, there’s nothing wrong with that.    

As long as it’s on topic and contributes to the discussion, that’s completely fine under the rules.  This is common in the Science and Spaceflight sub, as missions can take years to reach their destinations, and there will be little discussion during that travel.   We’d much rather you find the old thread and post there, then make us dig for it and then do a merge, which sometimes can be problematic.

The problem with actual necros is that the game has gone through so many versions over the years, the vast majority of game related threads are outdated, and modern answers won’t apply correctly.   Posting an answer that only works  in 1.9 or later versions in a thread relating to 1.3 games is a necro, and not a good thing.  Also, posting in a thread just to post in an old thread is heavily frowned upon.

> 
>
